intro: Ferula vicaria, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its height can reach up to 1 meter, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Ferula vicaria is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
